{"id":1243307344,"question_id":3388,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 month, 2 weeks","timestamp":1714229151,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"18 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1243307344/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Right Triangles","memory":"146.4 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public long numberOfRightTriangles(int[][] grid) {\n        \n        \n        int h= grid.length;\n        int w= grid[0].length;\n        \n        int[] cols =  new int[w];\n        int[] rows = new int[h];\n        \n        for(int i=0; i<h; i++){\n            for(int j=0; j<w; j++){\n                \n                if(grid[i][j]==1){\n                    \n                    rows[i]++;\n                    cols[j]++;\n                    \n                }\n                \n            }\n        }\n        \n        \n        long res = 0L;\n        for(int i=0; i<h; i++){\n            for(int j=0; j<w; j++){\n                \n                if(rows[i]<2 || cols[j]<2 || grid[i][j]==0) continue;\n                \n                long a = (long)rows[i]-1;\n                \n                long b = (long)cols[j]-1; \n                res += a*b;\n                // (n-1)+(n-2)+... + 1\n                    \n                // n * (n-1)/2;\n                \n            }\n        }\n        \n        \n        return res;\n        \n        \n        \n    }\n    \n//     private long cal(long cnt){\n        \n//         return  n*(n-1)/2;\n//     }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"right-triangles","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
